website_summaries.verdict: Versatile cooking options and delicious results make this rice cooker/pressure cooker an incredibly versatile kitchen gadget.
pros: Works faster and uses less energy than a traditional steamer
This cooker can do it all
cons: There can be a "learning curve" for those not familiar with pressure cooking

customer_reviews.title: I think I want to marry it.
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the only thing in my kitchen I use on an almost daily basis apart from my kettle, it will also save you a fortune, I now buy most of my food frozen or freeze any leftover fresh food, get home from work and bung it in the Instant Pot straight from frozen for 20 mins , and job done. I make a wicked curry when it's in slow cooker mode as well. I've bought an extra three of these for family and friends, you won't regret getting one, if you do , I'll buy it off you.
customer_reviews.author: Nigel Edmunds

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase ever!
customer_reviews.text: I've waited a long time for this to me back in stock and haven't been disappointed. I'm still learning how to use it but all my attempts have been a success from baked potatoes to delicious pulled pork. It appears easy to use but remember its not exactly "instant" as it does need to get up to pressure and then again release at the end of cooking so this needs to be factored in to cooking times. But it definitely does cut down on traditional methods and hopefully will save energy in the long run not needing to use my stove every night. So far it has been worth the wait and every penny!
customer_reviews.author: A. Brown

customer_reviews.title: No longer working after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: After 2 months of using and I only use it 3x a month, it has now stopped working. No longer follows preset time for pressure cooking. Onlh displays on, so you don’t know whether it has already built pressure and when it has started pressure cooking. Two dishes overcooked as a result. Return window is unfortunately 1 month only. Sad as I wasted a lot of money on a product that only lasted two months.
customer_reviews.author: Diana Gella

customer_reviews.title: Very good much needed makes my life so much simpler
customer_reviews.text: Very good much needed makes my life so much simpler. Being disabled cooking can be a pain but this gadget does the job. Well made simple to use I would recommend it and buy it again
customer_reviews.author: Terry P.

customer_reviews.title: Replacement had fatal electric fault
customer_reviews.text: I do not advise anybody to purchase this item. I returned the first one because it was damaged. The second one failed when I first used it. An error C6L appeared on the screen and nothing would work. Web forums inform me that the machine needs replacing. I do not want a repalcement. A refund, please, Amazon
customer_reviews.author: Simon H

customer_reviews.title: Wish I hadn’t bought it
customer_reviews.text: Later edit: I still think the manual is rubbish, but I’m definitely finding it easier to use now that I’ve got used to it. And it does make wonderful yoghurt! For £100, and a cult product, I expected it to be intuitively designed, and to have a detailed manual. Not so. I’ve nearly had a nervous breakdown just trying to figure out how the yoghurt settings work (in the end YouTube was helpful). It doesn’t give me confidence to try more complicated recipes. I wish so much I hadn’t wasted my money.
customer_reviews.author: Tab

customer_reviews.title: Wear on unit before use
customer_reviews.text: I only got this and upon opening I saw that it was well scratched and the enamel gone from the top where the lid meets the unit. I figured this was insignificant as it wasn’t in the cooking part of the pot and tried to do the initial test, only to find it kept giving the error of “Lid”. I now think all the wear was from a tester repeatedly trying to get it to lock. I’ve ordered a replacement but my confidence in this product has been knocked.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Not often a write a negative review and I'm pretty sure I just got unlucky with a dodgy one. So... I tried to make a tried and tested pressure cooker recipe from the Pinch of Nom cookbook but within minutes I got the "burn"warning. Food was ruined. Gave it one last chance but the same happened so I sent it back. I can't afford to waste money on something that may or may not burn my food. Also I didn't get the recipe book in my box. Amazon have given me a full refund so it's not a big deal but I was just gutted as a love a new shiny kitchen gadget.
customer_reviews.author: leenie

customer_reviews.title: Ease of use
customer_reviews.text: Had been thinking of buying one of these for a while but was unsure. Got it today made my first meal (pasta) and it was the best I've ever tasted. Took 5 mins to cook and 5 mins to natural release plus about the same to get to pressure, all in all 15mins. This will be perfect for coming in from work tired and used to eating junk, as I cannot be bothered to cook.
customer_reviews.author: Alan P

customer_reviews.title: Faulty Unit
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t get to use it as unit was faulty, lid shut detection error, sending it back to Amazon for refund but now unavailable. Will not be wasting my time again.
customer_reviews.author: Not Happy

customer_reviews.title: Complete rubbish
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace an older electric pressure cooker which eventually died. This brand is useless. I get a “burn” shutdown about 70%of the time even after deglazing, not putting tomatoes on the bottom etc. Our old one required none of this faffing around and worked perfectly every time. Expensive waste.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Giving Error - not impressed
customer_reviews.text: Hi, bought in the boxing day sale after looking at them for a few months. When I tried to do the water test i kept getting an 'EC' error. I have tried everything to fix it but to no avail. Have subsequently heard of a few others that have had the same issue as mine. Struggling to get any response with regards to replacing. Disappointed. Update.. this unit was duly sent back. I had contact with a few people on FB and it looks like there was a bad batch. The replacement has performed faultlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Electric plug for US use only
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed to buy in UK only to receive pot for EU
customer_reviews.author: marianna

customer_reviews.title: Slow cooker function is great and love the fact you can sautte off onions ...
customer_reviews.text: Got this on Black Friday offer. SUPERB!! Presuure cooker has 2 settings. Rice is cooked to perfection. Slow cooker function is great and love the fact you can sautte off onions etc prior to next part of cooking process. Does pasta a treat and no draining water afterwards. Suggest getting cook books and timing guides in order to make the most of this versatile cooker. Also has facebook forums which really are helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Bunjirabbit

customer_reviews.title: It was great while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: I loved this, my wife gave me grief as she saw it as another gadget that we would never use. She loved it too and would have used it loads. We bought special cookery books to get the best out of it. Sadly the Instant Pot didn't last. It still sauté's, slow cooks, cooks rice but it's not a pressure cooker anymore. We took so much care of it, certainly we didn't do anything wrong. It just stopped heating food enough to create steam and pressure.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. P. Foley

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace spacing taking separate rice cooker, stove tiered steamer and my small pressure cooker. Got it and have used it for all meals. So simple to use my 14 year old made steamed buns and I have made various dishes... chilli, Indian curry and rice dishes. At first all the buttons were daunting but after a few research for recipes on the web it was so simple. I love love love the Instant pot. For working mums it's the best thing - time saving and cooks perfect meals. It even tells you if you are burning your food!!!! Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs G Patel

customer_reviews.title: Love this - a real game changer
customer_reviews.text: I am delighted with my Instant pot Duo. It produces the most amazing - ribs, pulled pork and chicken wings. I look forward to some winter recipes which I fully expect to be delicious. I was surprised to read negative reviews and I can only imagine that people have purchased second hand or not read the instructions fully. I do agree that the instructions are a little 'wooly' but I have found that the online recipes available from various Instant Pot websites are very clearly explained and a great way to get to know how it works.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: Superb.  Combines a frying pan, saucepan, slow cooker and pressure cooker in one simple device !
customer_reviews.text: I call this the Magic Pot - because it's awesome. You can switch it from saute mode, to pressure cooker / hot pot etc. It cooks things really, really, well in no time. Soups are done in 20 minutes, a whole 4Lb chicken in about 25 minutes and chillis and stews are done in no time. This has replaced my frying pan, saucepan, slow-cooker and pressure cooker with one simple device.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. J. Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Could not use - Safety Hazard!
customer_reviews.text: I would have expected much better after reading reviews but when I received the Instant Pot the lid did not securely fit onto the unit. I have been worried about using the product as the steam would not be contained!! Dissapointed is an understatement.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Lynch

customer_reviews.title: It's Canadian
customer_reviews.text: Now I am a terrible cook. I ordered 'Gusto' ready-made recipes with easy to follow instructions and still messed up. I have been known to fail at a packet Lemon Meringue mix (the lemon capsule flew out of the pan). So I thought this was a good idea. But it uses the old ounces and pounds system, not metric. Also refer to 'cups' of ingredients and American versions of them. The instruction book also seems to be a bit complicated, if you hear of a large explosion in the Midlands i will have blown myself up. Will keep trying as it's too expensive to gather dust.
customer_reviews.author: Lynand

customer_reviews.title: Huge! Quite useful...
customer_reviews.text: First of all make sure you have the kitchen space, as this 5L+ model is huge! Needs its own cupboard really, as quite ugly when not in use. Anyway, very useful. Size comes in very handy for steaming whole (smallish) fish or whole veg. But when cooking rice, the size is ridiculous unless you have 12 kids. Slow cooking... not as good as a slowcooker, only heating from the bottom... which means stirring while slow cooking is pretty essential really. Haven't tried their recipe book yet... nothing to write home about. Worth it... but if you're only one or two people, maybe a smaller size would be just fine. Good value and build.
customer_reviews.author: P

customer_reviews.title: Keeps smells contained and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This has become my go to appliance for soups, curries, chillies and stews. It keeps the smells contained inside and I love knowing it can safely pressure cook things (I had a bad experience with a regular pressure cooker which exploded, so I would never buy one again). Fairly easy to clean (Apart from the rim around it which can be quite narrow, but fine with a slimline brush) and great for multiple dishes - happy with it
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina

customer_reviews.title: Some great features
customer_reviews.text: I have always used a pressure cooker on the hob on a regular basis. This one has the advantage of standing alone. It reaches the correct pressure and stays there, so does not have to be watched. It is very quiet. It seems slow to reach pressure and is then very slow to release the pressure at the end of cooking. It I open the vent, as advised in the literature, I have a spurt of steam entering the kitchen for a long time. This is the feature that means my rating is not 5 star.
customer_reviews.author: MarjB

customer_reviews.title: A little disappointed
customer_reviews.text: PRO: 1-saves time and energy on meals that normally take hours, like cooking beans 2- unattended cooking 3-good build - stainless steel CON: takes very long time (sometimes over 20 min) to reach the working pressure, and considering the time to relese pressure this makes the saved time from pressure cooking often useless I had a much simpler Hyundai pot, it reached the pressure cooking much faster, I think it is due to the fact the the Instant pot keeps disconnecting and reconnecting so the real heating time is very short, this is a safety measure but it make the whole thing useless in my opinion
customer_reviews.author: S. Abu Salih

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as my 40yr old dome typed Prestige cooker! Stopped working after a few weeks!
customer_reviews.text: Don't believe the hype! By the time I'd worked out how to use it....it packed-up, stopped working, no power. Extremely disappointed because I'd spent a lot of time researching it as a replacement for my 40yr old dome typed Prestige cooker. £100 is a lot to spend on a pot for me!
customer_reviews.author: aisha_m

customer_reviews.title: This will change your life.
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant. This has added so many options for our busy kitchen! Lots of unexpected bonuses, for example I never bothered cooking beetroot, not I can pressure cook in 20 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Neville Merritt

customer_reviews.title: Control panel not clear and instructions useless
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking and easy to clean. However the controls panel is not at all clear. I found the instructions so impossible to follow that I only use it for a pressure cooker for soups and sauces but because the control panel lighting is so unclear it is impossible to know if it is set on high or low pressure! It took quite a while to figure out how to secure the lid but I have got used to that now. I think this would be a good bitbif equipment if the control panel was lit better and if there were properly written instructions.
customer_reviews.author: J R

customer_reviews.title: Impressive as a slow & pressure cooker
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't impressed with other makes in Currys as they felt cheap - ended up buying IP in the Prime Day Sale & got a great deal. The IP felt much better quality, the lid was easy to close & also bought the glass lid to make slow cooking simple. Have used it more times in first 4 weeks than my slow cooker in the last 4 years as you can saute in it & have been really pleased with the pressure cooking too. Lamb Tagine in the booklet was unbelievably good!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A truly fantastic product
customer_reviews.text: Having used it a few times now, I truly enjoy this product. It is so much better than the previous (Cookjoy) pressure cooker I bought from Amazon in September 2018 for £69.99 - that didn't last long despite I didn't use it that often. It shows that buying from a big brand is better than taking a chance on an unknown brand. This Instant Pot is solidly built and the cover seals properly. The dishes that I cook with Instant Pot also taste better and the meat is more tender than the previous (Cookjoy) pressure cooker.
customer_reviews.author: VV

customer_reviews.title: Great function, but poor built quality
customer_reviews.text: I love cooking with this pressure cooker, but: - once every once in a while it makes horrible cracking noises whiile it is running - I had to return the first one because the coating of the pot was damaged - after less than 6 month the coating of the new pot already starts failing - the pressure release is very sensitive; the slightest vibration, e.g. someone walking past, might release preasure from the pot. Once steam starts leaking out, it won't fully close again.
customer_reviews.author: CD

customer_reviews.title: Very unsafe product. The pot exploded during high pressure!!
customer_reviews.text: Very unsafe product!! Don’t use it. The ventilation seal can be pushed easily forward so the ventilation is closed totally and the pressure cannot be released with the high pressure cooking. After 2 hours the instant pot exploded and the lit came of and my whole kitchen walls and ceiling has bone broth in it and is ruined!! I was lucky no one was standing close otherwise they would have been burned all over! If I hear nothing from the company I will hire an attorney. This product needs to get off the market ASAP!
customer_reviews.author: T. Heijwegen

customer_reviews.title: Magic pot!!
customer_reviews.text: I so love this magic pot I just ordered mini one as well. I got this only few days ago. I’m from India I cook loads lentils some of them I have to soak them over night then cook on pressure cooker for 7-8 hrs. I made red kidney beans from raw! It only took 35 minutes and taste even better. Amazing! I can go on and on.......easy to use pot itself bit scrubbing to bit rest is no problem. Love love love. Thanks for making my life easier.
customer_reviews.author: Raj & Monika Kaushal

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny spent:)
customer_reviews.text: Best Buy of the year! now i cook all dishes to do with pork or beef in the IP as the meat is so tender! Im skeptical about cooking chicken tho as It did make the meat really tender n fall off the bone..but it also kind make the chicken tasteless, maybe i have to adjust n shorten the time. And the only down part is the depressurisation time.. sometimes it took too long. But im still learning to adjust:) Overall, its not really overpriced n worth every penny spent:)
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: I would be lost without my instant pot!
customer_reviews.text: My my my Aboluteky love my instant pot! It’s revolutiokised the way I cook food! This genius device does everything for you, leaving you time to get on with other things. I’ve made banana cake, risotto, chicken, chicken broth, yoghurt, chilli, soup you make it I’ve made it. The timer function is also very useful I can bung all my stuff in before work and it will be ready for when I get home. Really would be lost with out it!
customer_reviews.author: Kim Wright

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: One of the best kitchen gadgets I'm bought in a long time...really makes cooking easier for non-cooks like me.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer Champion

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: I have had the instant pot a few weeks now and I have used it way more than expected. Could not be easier to use and is easy to clean and has great instructions. Key pad is straightforward and there are hundreds of YouTube tips on line as well as recipes. Well worth the money, a more expensive piece of kitchen kit and there are cheaper versions, but I can’t compare those as not used them. I would not give up this product!
customer_reviews.author: Tegzee

customer_reviews.title: ok for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Works ok for the price. Keep Warm function exists, but it is better not to use it, as your rice will get dried up quite quickly and leaves inedible dried up crust on the surface. So, I normally just cook the portion I can consume, and ditch the keep warm function.
customer_reviews.author: roseroyale

customer_reviews.title: Very Useful and timesaving ...
customer_reviews.text: I had to take time to research recipes and learn by 'trial and error' but its an excellent item. At first I kept getting 'burn' message so I don't use 'Saute' setting as its too severe (I saute in a frying pan then transfer). I am used to non-stick pans and I believe there's a non-stick pot insert available to buy separately. Its very good for steamed puddings, rice puddings too.
customer_reviews.author: AnnL

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase I ever made
customer_reviews.text: I can not believe I never had this in my life. I’ve used this to make curries, lamb roasts even a biryani. Being a mum of two this has really come in handy. Makes my life so much easier. I made a roast Lamb shoulder in 55 min. That would usually take 5 hours! My mum does not like pressure cookers. She says the food doesn’t taste the same. However, when I’ve cooked with this I’ve not told her and she has been blown away every time. Now she wants one! I highly highly recommend this. Best purchase I ever made
customer_reviews.author: Haris Zafar

customer_reviews.title: Wow.  I am now a convert
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased the Instant Pot pressure cooker because I have heard so much hype about it. They were correct. Rice cooked to perfection how you like it and meat cooked quick and yet still tender and fall off the bone. I will be using the Instant Pot more and cooking food in batch for my lunch at work. Try buy it when it is on discount! You will not regret this great purchase. Also this product makes my mums recipe tastes like my mum cooks it herself!
customer_reviews.author: badlydrawnkid

customer_reviews.title: A great applicance
customer_reviews.text: What a brilliant appliance. It cooks very well and quickly. The inner pot is very easy to clean and I love that it is a slow cooker too. I recommend purchasing the optional slow cooker lid to use slow cooker mode. I Just regret not buying one sooner. Well worth the money. Also I have a disability and struggle with pots and pans etc. This device makes life so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best buy ever!  Quick healthy meals, silent, clean, no smell and dishwasher safe
customer_reviews.text: Amazing pot!!! Was looking for a rice cooker, then stumbled upon this beauty. What can I say, it revolutionized the way I cook, best buy ever. Cooks beans from dry, no soaking needed, in 40 minutes. Silent, no smells whatsoever, you just chuck the ingredients in and forget about it til ready. There are several recipes online, easy to follow; I made stews and soups, as well as rice, and everything was cooked beautifully. The lid and internal pot are dishwasher safe, which is a bonus. Stainless steel means healthy cooking, and food won’t stick. Couldn’t imagine my day without my instant pot now, perfect for busy families. My 5.6 litres easily feeds 5 adults.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara P

customer_reviews.title: Basically a pressure cooker and slow cooker combined
customer_reviews.text: Seems ok, not amazing, all food is basically pressure cooker taste or slow cooker taste, i needed a new pressurw cooker which alone was only £20 less as I wanted a stainless steel good quality one, this is also stainless steel inside, which is healthier as regards cooking toxins, if I wasn't needing a pressure cooker and I owed a slow cooker as I do already, I feel it would have been money wasted as it is to me only equal to those two items
customer_reviews.author: aw

customer_reviews.title: A game changer for busy families!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this for just under a tear now and honestly couldn’t do without it! The options are endless, quick and mega easy! This makes cooking a doddle. A roast chicken in half an hour. Crispy, juicy, just perfect. Hone made rice pudding in 20 minutes. Both are family favourites and absolute staples now thanks to this instant pot. Easy to clean and looks well on the kitchen side. Just brilliant, a game changer for busy families!
customer_reviews.author: marycomealive

customer_reviews.title: Versatile product ...excellent build quality
customer_reviews.text: Never wanted to buy another gadget which I cannot use ... this is different ... Precise ... sensor controlled but safe pressure cooker .... you can control texture of food ... you can rely on duration .... lentils doesn’t need to be soaked overnight .... build quality is Fantastic .... inner stainless steel pot so well made ..:. You can sauté ... then steam ... pressure cook .... so many other programmable options .... in my house predominantly used for vegetarian cooking ... I can only imagine how controlled non veg cooking can be ..:: All in all .... brilliant household gadget to have ... thanks Regards
customer_reviews.author: xvish

customer_reviews.title: Heap of Junk
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because of all the good reviews, it's so badly put together, plastic on lid is not sealed properly and there is steam coming out of places steam should not be coming out of, made of cheap flimsy material, so upset as I'd read all the reviews and don't quite understand it and I usually give most things 4 or 5 stars, so has to be really bad for me to give one and I only gave that because the delivery was very good... 😭
customer_reviews.author: Celine Power

customer_reviews.title: Danger of injuries with hot water
customer_reviews.text: The Product implies a testing before start using it. During the testing, if item is faulty, severe burns and injures from hot water spit thru the steam button on the lid might occur. I find this absolutely necessary to be displayed on the product and interested customers made aware about it, before purchasing it/ testing it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Kunde

customer_reviews.title: Very good multifunctional pot
customer_reviews.text: It’s not the best multifunctional pot on the market but comes at very close 2nd. Hubby loves cooking in it since you can make literally anything in it. For me the main minus was the instructions manual as it wasn’t extensive (not actually explained what programs to use or what program buttons are for) I like to follow instructions and unfortunately this pot is just not for me.
customer_reviews.author: Skai

customer_reviews.title: My favorite most useful gadget.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic gadget to have. I can understand why the Americans have gone potty over these. Can cook a full meal or boil eggs in this. Looking forward to trying it out on plenty more receipts in the future. If you use a lot of cooked chicken then just cook a whole one in this for 28 mins - leave it to release itself then when chicken is cool you can split it up for salads,sandwiches,wraps etc. Fantastic pulled pork , mince receipts etc etc and you only have to wash the one pot as you can use this to saute your meat / veg before putting on to slow cook or pressure cook because it's stainless steel.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing indeed
customer_reviews.text: The lid is so very difficult to clean and the silicone seal is virtually impossible to rid of any cooking odour. I have to soak the seal in a bleach solution and put in dishwasher a couple of times before the smell goes. In all the Instant Pot is a total disappointment. There was no recipe book, I had to purchase separately. To be honest it is a disappointment all round and would never recommend it to anyone. Also, it seems to burn food on one side of the bottom of pot? I cannot believe some of the revues I have read. Did they purchase the same Instant Pot that I was sent?!?
customer_reviews.author: Carol Anne

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and really great quality, highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 one for myself and family member. I’ve used an electric pressure cooker for a few years. Wish I’d bought the instant Pot instead. It’s brilliant absolutely love it. So versatile and the stainless steel pot instead of a non stick one is so much better. I slid like the accessories you can buy too. Great idea to have 2 inner pots, will definitely be doing that, also the pressure ring itself does get a little smelly after cooking a curry etc. so again, handy to be able to buy others in different colours if you want. Cannot recommend highly enough.
customer_reviews.author: Scoops

customer_reviews.title: Quality stainless inner pot, easy to use electric pressure cooker with saute & keep warm function.
customer_reviews.text: As outlined in the headline, its an excellent product, with a food-safe stainless inner pot suitable for fridge storage, using available glass lid. It has a valuable adjustable saute function, keep-warm choice, and is simple and straightforward to use on a regular basis. Cannot fault it, other than would have preferred that the bottom inner pot would not be bowed inwards by design, regarding using the saute, but can live with it. Would highly recommend this as a unique amazing must-have kitchen product!
customer_reviews.author: Ortwin L.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I’ve got a sous vide, an air fryer and numerous other kitchen appliances, but I would keep this above all of them. The sauté function is amazing, especially at the end if I need to reduce the fluid and thicken. Twenty minutes for a beef stew, English, French whatever, meat is so soft. It’s taken me a while to get the fluid levels right, but that is down to me and not the machine. So easy to clean. I’ve not done rice as I have rice cooker, nor the porridge or yoghurt, but I’m sure they would work well given how the other functions work. In a nutshell easy to use and easy to clean, perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Rosco

customer_reviews.title: Highly Versatile Kitchen Gadget
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on a recommendation from a friend. I have to admit on the first few uses I wasn't particularly impressed, but after sticking with it, I have to agree it's a great bit of kit. The key is finding recipes that work for you. Cleaning is a doddle, and it really does do everything that it claims.
customer_reviews.author: Rob T

customer_reviews.title: Under pressure.
customer_reviews.text: Waited for some time for this .... so far so good . First impressions are it's extremely well built and top quality. Cooked rice straight off the bat using the non stick inner on auto rice cook . Need to use a little less water than my old 8 in 1 but a promising syart with a near perfect non stick conclusion. Only time and more cooking will see if it lives up to the hype.
customer_reviews.author: Just Jack.

customer_reviews.title: It has durability problem due to falty programming ...
customer_reviews.text: It was a great product and I was really happy with cooking using it. But, after only several times of cooking, it will not cook any more and giving the error message "Lid". However, the lid should not be a problem when in the saute mode. Really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: syedhasan1964

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional
customer_reviews.text: Probably one of the best gadgets I’ve ever purchased. Did loads of research and this came out top with the KingPro. I went with this as it had better features. Sauté is something else !! Amazing Haven’t used the slow cooker option but with a pressure cooked amazing meal in 15 mins max, why would I. I’ve Donte the best chicken breast dish ever, in 10 mins !! But tastes like it’s been slow cooked for hours. Meat holds its shape unlike the slow cooker when meat can something disintegrate. Looking forward to doing some joints of meat.
customer_reviews.author: Andie

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!!
customer_reviews.text: This absolutely AMAZING kitchen accessory is a marvel!!! It has been in constant use since I bought it and it has totally transformed the way I cook meals. It’s so quick to knock up a risotto, stew, mac’n’cheese etc that I don’t give it a second thought to cooking up a tasty meal when I come home from work during the week. It will replace my slow cooker, rice cooker and steamer. I cannot recommend it highly enough. Anyone buying one should also join the Uk instant pot community page on Facebook for advice, recipes and more. It’s so good I bought one for my partner too.
customer_reviews.author: Alwyn

customer_reviews.title: constant burn notices
customer_reviews.text: It works really well on simple things. However hard I try, when it comes to making something a bit more interesting with sauces and stocks Burn notice. And there is usually nothing burning. The on board sensor is so sensitive that half a stuck pepper corn set it off. In spite of following to the letter a 5 star rated cook book. Burn notice. I get that no one wants burned food but it really is very sensitive. To get a decent stew type dish the liquid has to over whelm the food.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie Foster

customer_reviews.title: Impressive little thing
customer_reviews.text: An update to my previous review.I have now been using it regularly since July . The speed of cooking is the most impressive feature. I have made several curries, dals all South Indian dishes in no time. Use this weekly for fermenting yoghurt and making idly batter and I see idly batter making will be no issue at all in the British winter too that brings smiles at home. Making idli itself takes only 4 minutes as opposed to the usual 20 minutes with traditional cooking.Have seen the 3 litre introduced to UK market will be buying it. Can’t live without this gadget
customer_reviews.author: Yenem

customer_reviews.title: Insta pot
customer_reviews.text: Instapot is very useful in any kitchen. It is versatile as in you can steam,saute or pressure cook all using this one gadget. I cook lentils and pulses a lot and find this very handy. My only regret is I brought it when the price was quite high at £120 pounds and after that I have seen price range from £79 - £99. Maybe I could have waited to get a better price, as I feel a littel bit let down on price.
customer_reviews.author: Gayathri

customer_reviews.title: Quick, easy one pot cooking..
customer_reviews.text: A friend raved about the Instant Pot so I checked it out online. Very pleased I did! I’m nothing more than an ordinary cook but this speeds things up and keeps in the nutrients which I’m all for. I’ve used it regularly and the added advantage is that I use up all my left over veg for soups with little or no effort - I now don’t have to supervise a large pan boiling over on the hob. Very pleased although I wish I’d bought the one with the valve diffuser which has recently come out..
customer_reviews.author: linjo59

customer_reviews.title: Nice and easy cooker
customer_reviews.text: Very nice pressure cooker. Easy to read instructions and loads of functionalities too. Only made a beef stew so far but it's produced an amazing flavour. I do recommend doing the test as suggested first though. If you have not worked with a pressure cooker before, it can be a little scarry. After using it on pressure cook, you have to let the steam out before lifting the cover or you can end up with quite a mess which is what we would have done if we didn't do the test run first. This product is definately a recommend!
customer_reviews.author: nlicheva

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I have wanted an Instant Pot for ages and finally treated myself in the Boxing Day sale. I was expecting rolled eyes from my partner for buying yet another kitchen appliance (our kitchen is tiny), but after the first meal he is as hooked as I am. So far we have cooked honey mustard chicken stew (8 minutes for the chicken to be falling apart) and prawn fried rice (7 minutes and the best I have ever cooked). The machine is easy to clean and easy to use. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: pinkgecko

customer_reviews.title: I love my Instant Pot
customer_reviews.text: I love my Instant Pot! I use it multiple times a week. I only cook rice in the IP now, works brilliantly. I also find it really useful as I have chronic illnesses so I can set the IP away and forget it - even if I have a nap, it just keeps it warm till I'm ready.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra

customer_reviews.title: Prompt tasty food
customer_reviews.text: Purchased on Black Friday 2018 as part of an offer. Fast cooking. You can do Biryani and any type of sauce in a third of the time needed on a traditional cooking hob. The kingpin feature is the stainless steel pot (instead of the usual aluminium), which makes food taste nice and it is a healthier option. With regards to durability, only time will tell as I only bought it last month.
customer_reviews.author: Hayden Smith

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my wife as a replacement for her much-loved but ageing and increasingly ineffective pressure cooker, this is so much more and is now used all the time. The wide range of features makes it very versatile in the kitchen and the timer means she can prepare, set and leave it to work. I have successfully made yogurt very easily and foresee the Instant Pot taking up permanent residence on the worktop. Great product, high recommended.
customer_reviews.author: RR Waller

customer_reviews.title: Totally changed the way I cook
customer_reviews.text: This IP has totally changed the way I cook, with so many easy receipes to choose from I now very rarely buy pre-made meals. Home made yogurt is delicious, soups are quick and easy, a large chicken fits in the 6l pot, come out fully cooked and moist. Made cheesecake at the weekend, tasted amazing. There are lots of receipes online and on YouTube to choose from. Absolutely love the Instant Pot!!!
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Bell

customer_reviews.title: For the dedicated cook
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bit of kit and has the possibility of saving you loads of cooking time. You can produce some great quality meals. The only draw-backs from this UK user is that many of the cookbooks are in US measures and it's a bit inconvenient to convert everything. It's also quite a complex device so will take some time to learn. However, if you're a dedicated cook it will be a great help.
customer_reviews.author: David McLeary

customer_reviews.title: Almost too good
customer_reviews.text: As an italian its hard to cook with american appliances and recipes...but this is so bloody good! From soups to ribs, this machine still hasnt failed me, i even did a cheesecake ffs ahah
customer_reviews.author: nick

customer_reviews.title: Like it,  but there is a learning curve
customer_reviews.text: So far I have cooked chick peas, beetroot and steamed potatoes. The potatoes were a bit of a disaster (they had to be boiled after the given cooking time) but the rest was fine. I will know more next time I use the pot for potatoes. I find it easier than using a normal pressure cooker on the electric hob and it doesn't heat or steam up the kitchen. That is why I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Omentide

customer_reviews.title: Love this baby!
customer_reviews.text: It has made my life so much easier! I love the fact that I don’t have to constantly stir, check, add more water etc. I have made so many lovely dishes - pea and ham soup was ready in 40 minutes, chicken soup was done in 20 minutes! And it tastes absolutely fantastic, too. I had purchased another pot that goes inside plus the glass lid - now I can also use the slow cook mode. I really recommend it for busy families, it makes life so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Vi

customer_reviews.title: Buy this device
customer_reviews.text: Oh my god. If I had known that this would be the item I will love the most in the kitchen. Whoever invented this device has a VIP corner reserved in heaven. Cooks phenomenal, extremely on time, does perfect yogurt. Anything I've tried with this cooker, it made it PERFECTLY. 10/10. If I get a bigger place, I will definitely buy another one. No jokes.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice kitchen appliance. Replaced my rice cooker and slow cooker I use it for cooking all kind of rice (you can follow the instruction about measuring at first then adapt to your like later on) Use for soup Roast can be done as well Be careful as this machine can turn Veggies in to dust like Thanos! if your timing is wrong, basically if you cook stew do the meat first put veg later don’t put together otherwise you vegs will turn into mush. Extra silicon ring would be nice since you cannot 100% get rid of the smell on the thing, get extra rings for difference categories of food.
customer_reviews.author: S.Gem

customer_reviews.title: great appliance, must have for families and professionals - beware when releasing the pressure valve
customer_reviews.text: disliked the huge mess it make when releasing the valve after making porridge - hot porridge liquid squirted out of the top making a huge mess. this being said it is a great product and have made great dishes - fish, rice, vegetables which takes much less time and creates a perfect result. Just be careful with things like porridge
customer_reviews.author: S.L.W

customer_reviews.title: BEST. INVESTMENT.EVER
customer_reviews.text: One magic item that does so many things!! Haven't even tried all functions yet but I am in LOVE. I follow a keto diet and batch cook every Sunday for the week. I am done sooner, have less to clean and the stove stays clean...what else could you possibly want! Just wish it would come with an accessory option as the variety out there is overwhelming.
customer_reviews.author: Emel

customer_reviews.title: Cooking simplified
customer_reviews.text: thanks to the technology and the make. We ordered and received on time. We do lots of cooking and love hot fresh foods. With this cooker, our time saved and options are lot do do. Both of us love cooking with this and the instructions comes handy. the functions are well able to understand and user friendly. also helpful to use multiple pots to cook - using pots in pot to cook. One suggestion for improvement: option to have lower sizes (3QT) like in US.
customer_reviews.author: Ramesh

customer_reviews.title: Seriously buy one!
customer_reviews.text: We've made curry, yogurt, tagines, stews, soups, for the first month we hardly used the hob or the oven and we still use it a lot less. My girlfriend was after a slow cooker and I wanted a pressure cooker. This fulfilled both needs perfectly. It can seem a little anti intuitive to begin with but within a few uses you'll never look back. Well packaged, comes with simple instructions and some handy accessories.
customer_reviews.author: HashTag

customer_reviews.title: It has permanent establishment on my kitchen counter
customer_reviews.text: And that's saying something! I love this machine so much I've found myself spontaneously raving to friends about it. It's completely replaced my old stove-top pressure cooker, and even my slow-cooker. Having never thought I would make my own yoghurt, I now do this weekly. I recommend you join the Facebook page as it's got a wealth of useful info and tips as well as handy recipes written and tested by UK users (so no weird ingredients or measurements).
customer_reviews.author: Xyla

customer_reviews.title: Loving it!
customer_reviews.text: I am in love with this pot! So practical especially if you don’t like cooking and don’t have time for it, but would like to eat some proper food instead of take away or processed quick supermarket food. Extremely safe and quiet pressure cooker, you can cook rice (in 4 min!), stews, beans, hummus and so many other things in less than 30min. The recipe app is a great tool! Highly recommend! The keep warm function is also very helpful!
customer_reviews.author: Christine B.

customer_reviews.title: Best kitchen appliance ever!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this pot for a few weeks now and I absolutely love it. No longer do I need to pre soak split peas and other beans overnight, I can just chuck them all straight in the pot and they are ready in 15 minutes. I have scoured the internet getting recipes together and have made some fantastic meals. I cannot praise this pot highly enough and the next time I see it on offer i will be purchasing another one.
customer_reviews.author: Paula Walls

customer_reviews.title: fantastic kitchen device
customer_reviews.text: Pressure cooking is fast, economical and can make great dishes. My slow cooker has been shelved now, this can slow cook too, although why bother, I've made soups and pulled beef roasts in this at a fraction of the time and energy and tastes just as great.
customer_reviews.author: A Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use with consistent results
customer_reviews.text: Love it worth having just for perfect pilua rice and boiled eggs every single time. Great for cooking chicken breasts from frozen, and great for slow cooking meats and stews (most of the people saying it's not good as a slow cooker are using the wrong setting) Everything I've cooked in a stove top pressure cooker has turned out as good or better, plus with endless recipes and videos online there are lots of things to give a go
customer_reviews.author: Mike1234

customer_reviews.title: An Instant hit with me!
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love! I haved used my Pot multiple times a week every week since I got it. If you're considering buying one, then I am sure you will love it. Have tried a couple of other slightly cheaper brands in the past, and they inevitabily fail after perhaps a year. Not had any issues with Instant Pot - have even bought a second one as a present for family, and both are still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: Dan C

customer_reviews.title: Essential household item. Quick, tasty and healthy food.
customer_reviews.text: After all the hype I decided to give this a go. No regrets, some fantastic meals with so many options. I love the simplicity of being able to throw a lot of ingredients in to produce a tasty & healthy meal in under an hour. Would not be without this. Cannot stress enough how tasty the stews and casseroles have been. So many recipes still to try out.
customer_reviews.author: S. L. Corry

customer_reviews.title: Game changer
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this now for several months. I was skeptical at first, a few of my friends bought them and couldn't stop talking about it. I bought it when it was on offer at Amazon for a good price. I have to say, I'm a complete convert! Some of the recipes we've tried haven't worked that well, but most are restaurant quality with little to no effort involved! I have no idea why anyone would use a slow cooker again.
customer_reviews.author: RobinPG

customer_reviews.title: Magic pot
customer_reviews.text: Totally changed my menu reportoire. Use about 3 times a week. I’m a busy full time working mum of 2 children. Kids call it the magic pot. There is a learning curve using pressure cookers as need to adjust fluid/flavours but easy to learn. Bought this over a slow cooker as it also has the slow cooker function
customer_reviews.author: Elaine

customer_reviews.title: Unit lacked basic QC before shipping!
customer_reviews.text: As you can see in the picture- I just received my new Instant Pot DUO. Upon taking it out of the box, I immediately noticed that the bottom of the unit is completely exposed with all the wires and circuits are exposed (a blue wire is almost dangling from the bottom. This can’t be correct or safe!
customer_reviews.author: Adel Essa

customer_reviews.title: Just buy one! you wont regret it!
customer_reviews.text: Single best kitchen appliance we have ever had! It cooks a chicken in 30 mins and oozes with moisture when cutting it, cooks veg to perfection, perfect rice, pasta, spag bol, beef stew and all from one pot! even tells you if your about to burn something when frying chicken or simmering a sauce to high and shuts off until the temps dropped a bit (i'm always burning pans so this is great for me!) its easy to use, easy to clean, feels very solid and well built, only thing if I was to be picky is Id wish it came with the non stick ceramic bowl as standard instead of the £30 extra!. Overall absolutely brilliant!
customer_reviews.author: do

customer_reviews.title: Cooking made easier and cheaper
customer_reviews.text: This pressure cooker is great, it took a little getting use to as I have a more traditional stove pressure cooker; the end cooking is a lot easier and quieter compared to my old one. For those of you that may be using an older pressure cooker on an electric hob, I would recommend upgrading to this pressure cooker. Only one small issue is removing the pot when hot in order to drain the water, maybe the designer can develop some form of clip-on handle/strainer.
customer_reviews.author: Farmer

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: OK.. so far I have used the soup, saute and the stew meat and have found it easy to use. It reaches pressure quickly even from cold and it is silent when cooking which is great. The inside stainless steel pot is fantastic and really easy to clean. Personally i wish i had bought this years ago, it is a fantastic product and seem to be accurate in its timings... i am very impressed and would recommend it to anyone, very easy to use and efficient on power usage too.
customer_reviews.author: Hummingbird

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Good product. Quick delivery and well packed. So far no issues. Personally I only bought to make stews and pressure cooking. I'm sure I can make rice much easier and faster on a regular pan. Pay attention to the temperature. My first meal got stuck at the button of the pot. The information book can be confuse. I advise you to have a look on YouTube. There is very good explanation videos.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality build has no compromise
customer_reviews.text: Was sceptic when my wife insisted to invest on this, but now have no regrets. It's worth an investment. Its easy to use and very straight with instructions. Cooks efficiently as I wanted this to prepare food for kids when travelling. Bit bulky but can easily fit in my car for travel. You can keep the food for preparation in the morning and when back to home by evening hot food is ready to be served. Best part is you can use even smaller steel vessels for cooking small portions of food. Steaming, stir frying, slow cooking, boiling,... and what not. Quality build is simply amazing. Durable for daily use or travel use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BRILLIANT PIECE OF KIT
customer_reviews.text: All the positives about this are true so no need for me to repeat. Not a lot of info on timings for certain foods etc. but there are lots and lots and lots of videos and recipes on You Tube and elsewhere telling you how to use it, not to mention the products own website. One thing not included and you will need to get is a steamer basket for vegetables etc. Difficult and sometimes messy just using the rack. Don't know why one is not included. Also many say that you will need to buy a replacement seal eventually, but they are freely available and easily fitted. Best piece of kitchen kit we own.
customer_reviews.author: Mungle Estronius Thorquip

customer_reviews.title: Super Instant Pot Pressire Cooker
customer_reviews.text: It is early days. I would prefer to review in say, 6 months. I did have a Pressure King Pro but in the space of 18 months I had 3 as each one either developed a fault or something broke off it or a part was missing. I know how these pressure cookers work. I have to say that first impressions of the Instant Pot are excellent. Looks good, easy to use, easy to clean and the bowl and accessories can go in a dishwasher. I wanted this first time round but it was very expensive. As the price has come down I decided to pay the extra after my refund. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: pauline

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant gadget and I’ve not yet mastered all it can do!
customer_reviews.text: Looking for a replacement slow cooker and ended up with this, as a slow cooker it’s the most fabulous one I’ve had. In the pressure cooker ( of which I’d no previous experience) I’ve mastered lentil soup in 20 mins and stews. I’m yet to try baking or youghurt making, i’ll get there one day but I think this is a brilliant invention and would buy it again
customer_reviews.author: EM

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: I simply love my Instant Pot. Since it’s arrival I have “literally” used it every day and hardly had the oven on so an added bonus - it’s saving the environment too! I bought it with the instant pot vegan cookbook and me and my carnivore husband have enjoyed everything we have made. I can’t wait to get the steamer accessories so Zi can make more stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Julia Daker

customer_reviews.title: So easy
customer_reviews.text: Throw away your rice cooker , slow cooker, everything. This is amazing. You can read all the recipes etc online, bear in mind it does need to come to temperature so yes you can cook a whole chicken in 20-30 minutes but give it 10 to heat up. Read the recipes online to see if it is for you, but I would say if you use a slow cooker or rice cooker anyway ditch those, and have an all in one with a faster option. The inside pot can go in the dishwasher too.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Priest

customer_reviews.title: Slow to start - soggy vegetables
customer_reviews.text: This comes with lots of modes that we are experimenting with. Sadly the core function, pressure cooking vegetables quickly to preserve their taste and texture, has been an absolute failure. The instructions demand 500ml of water for safety. By the time the pressure cooker has got up to temperature and pressure, the vegetables are an overcooked, soggy mess. It's just too slow to get started. Hopefully it will do better with recipes that take longer, but we bought it mainly for more convenient healthy veg than our (much cheaper) on-the-hob pressure cooker, and it is not in the same league.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: So Happy With This Purchase
customer_reviews.text: After the first few times of hiding behind the kitchen door when this is on, I absolutely love the instant pot. I think everyone is sick of me saying "I made this in the Instant Pot" now, but literally every meal is made in there. It's easy and clear to use, and does exactly as it says on the tin and then some. I've just bought the accessories kit and I can't wait to try making Cheesecake this weekend! I'm not domestically gifted at all, but there are so many recipes online to follow just made for the Instant Pot that it's hard to mess anything up!
customer_reviews.author: Lou

product_meta.title: PentaBeauty Steam Cleaner, Chemical-Free Steam Cleaning with 9-Piece Accessory Set, Multi-Purpose Steam Cleaner with Safe Lock for Stain Removal, Curtains, Car Seats, Floor, Window and More
product_meta.description:
Color:Blue9-Piece Accessories:
1 × measuring cup
1 × funnel
1 × window cleaning tool
1 × round nylon brush
1 × upholstery tool
1 × towel cloth
1 × Jet nozzle
1 × bent nozzle
1 ×39.37 inch Flexible Hose with Gun Nozzle

Correct use steps:
Open the safety cap
Add about 250 ML of water with a funnel and measuring cup;
Emply the steam ;
Put on the accessories;
Plug in the power cord and wait 3-4 minutes to warm up;
When the LED light from red to no light, that means the water is heat up and can use to clean your house. But first, you need to drive the safe lock.
feature_bullets: Powerful Hot: High-pressure 2050 watts steamer for powerful cleaning; cleans spotless even the toughest dirt and stains. Features a 12 oz. Water capacity and emits continuous steam for up to 20 minutes.

9 Free Accessories Set: Our powerful handheld steam cleaner Set includes 9 free pieces accessory kit which includes: measuring cup, funnel, window cleaning tool, round nylon brush, upholstery tool, towel cloth, jet nozzle, towel Sleeve, bent nozzle.

Multi-purpose Use: Our handheld steam cleaner unit is best suited for sealed surfaces including ceramic, vinyl, laminate, granite, marble, hardwood floors, and it's great for sinks, stoves, counter tops, refrigerators, kitchen, floor, living room, windows, toilet, tiles, shower curtains, bathroom, pet toilet, car Seats and rims, grill, BBQ, kids toy, mattresses, linen, duvet cover, fabric and sofa cleaning.

Chemical Free and Safe: Unique safety lock design and overheated protection for extra protection of your safety! Engage the safety lock when the device is idle to avoid accidental harm to children or pets; automatic shut-off if there is no water in the tank or the boiler temperature is higher than 230°F/120°C.
Easy Handheld Use: Handheld cleaner design makes it easy to carry from room to room.Lightweight and portable unit comes with a long 9.8-foot cord for convenient indoor and outdoor use.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars6,272 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
